name: Menzies London Luton Strathmore

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night as I needed to be nearly for a business conference the next day. Booked on line and was charged a v reasonable £49, less than the on line prices for both the local Travelodge and Premier Inn.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Very Good Value, Parking Odd but Fine
Not four star service
reviews.text: As I would be arriving late and leaving early I was looking for a comfortable, clean room to sleep in and that was what I got. The room was quite nice - I would describe it as a very typical hotel room - quite plush in fact but lacking any real character, but that was ok. I was on one of the upper floors and it was nice and quiet. The staff were businesslike and helpful.

The car parking was a bit odd as it involved leaving the car in an allocated part of a multi storey car park the other end of the shopping centre and then walking through the shopping centre to the hotel. As I arrived late (gone 12) this was strange as the shopping centre was completely empty apart from a security guard at one end who directed me to the hotel entrance. I was pleased that I had called the hotel earlier and had got directions (a post code for the sat nav) for the car park entrance which might otherwise had been difficult to find.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can see that some people might find the walk from the car park to the hotel a little bit unnerving, as multi storey car parks are rather strange places at night, but it was only a question of walking to the lifts nearby which go straight into the shopping centre. There were about 15 other cars there and I did not feel my car was unsafe being left overnight. Also an advantage in the cold weather because the windscreen would not ice up.
reviews.title: lovely stay....will def stay again

reviews.text: Overall I would recommend the hotel and was perfectly satisfied with my choice and thought it was very good value.
reviews.title: couldnt have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time we have had our staff annual fuction at the Menzies Luton, food fanstastic, great atmosphere,service brilliant .Many of our staffed stayed the night.,and enjoyed the great breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: staff christmas party

reviews.text: All the team great thankyou.
reviews.title: Ignore any negative reviews about this Hotel.... it's absolutely brilliant

reviews.text: Ignore any negative reviews about this Hotel.
reviews.title: Uninspiring - annoyed me enough to write my first review!

reviews.text: I am part of the social committee for a large international organisation. We held our Christmas Party in the Best Western Strathmore Hotel in Luton this year. We needed a venue which was easy to get to, could cater for a large party (there were over 160 of us who attended) and had accommodation.
reviews.title: terrible experience

reviews.text: Location: This Hotel is in the centre of Luton and just a short drive from the M1. We had people travelling from Hemel and Milton Keynes without any difficulty. The car park is secure and manned 24 hours by a security guard who lets you up and down the lift. There is no need to go through the shopping mall since the lift takes you to just outside the Hotel.
reviews.title: Cold room, cheap shower, dirty shower curtain, cold reception and bar area, lack of staff, poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you have to stay in or near Luton, avoid this hotel, it is souless, lacking any thing I could praise it for for this number of stars.I have been to better Travelodges.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.text: It is in a shoppinhg centre which is being refurbished, I hope they do the same to the hotel
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Friendly Staff, Plenty of Excellent Food

reviews.text: Our king size room was tiny. The bathroom was really small with a very big basin that made it even smaller, my partner and I are thin, heavens knows how one manages if you are a big person.The toilet was grubby, I tried to clean it before we used it,but it needed proper cleaning stuff. There is no fan in the bathroom and no air con in the room. The window had to be open all night as it was the only way to stop me feeling claustrophobic. The noise from the street was incredible, so loud! We have never slept so badly in a hotel.
reviews.title: Unbelieveable value for money

reviews.text: Breakfast continues till 11am on a Sunday, but by 10.30am most hot food was past it, no one came to refill dishes and there were no eggs of any description in the 15 minutes we were in the room. I heard the table next to ours ask the waitress if the eggs she ordered were ever coming!
reviews.title: Central location but not the best

reviews.text: We did not have dinner there, despite the AA rosettes, we were put off by the water carafes, yuk, and the motorway services circa 1980's set up for the food.
reviews.title: The most friendly and helpful hotel staff I have ever come across!

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights with a large group on business. On checking in five rooms were double booked and part of my group were sent to an alternative hotel by taxi. They then had to return as they could not obtain any food at the other venue due to the late hour. After a quick bar meal they then had to get another taxi back to the hotel. They were promised an upgrade for the remainder of the trip but there was no recognisable difference. In fairness the manager provided some complimentary drinks for our group. I'm led to believe that the hotel makes a profit by providing rooms for stranded passengers and flight crew from the airport and ships out the unfortunate guests to other hotels. Not such a big deal if you had just made a reservation but a bit of a liberty when a party had paid for 15 rooms up front for 4 nights
reviews.title: Ok for a night

reviews.text: In short. Spar is good. Bar food good. Restaurant average. Breakfast ok. Rooms nothing special. Service hit and miss
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel, helpful staff, nice leisure facilities

reviews.text: Not much better than a Travelodge to be honest, only the use of the pool makes it worthwhile
reviews.title: Good Location, Comfortable Stay - Menzies Strathmore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not the worst place to stay but glad I wasn't picking up the bill
reviews.title: Reception is not goo!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at hotel while husband did cookery course nearby at Tea Green.
reviews.title: wonderful service

description: Modern 4 star hotel situated in the town centre overlooking St. George's Square. Minutes from London Luton Airport, across the road from London Luton train station and 2 miles from the M1 motorway. Lots to do on the doorstep of the hotel within walking distance. New shopping mall 2010.
